article.headline: Xavier 86, American University 68
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Josh Duncan had a career-high 23 points Saturday to lead Xavier to an 86-68 win over American. Justin Doellman scored 17, Justin Cage added 16 and Stanley Burrell had 10 as Xavier (4-1) shot 57 percent from the floor in the second half to stretch a 35-33 halftime lead. Duncan, who sat out Xavier's preseason games with a strained back but has scored in double figures in four straight games, made a pair of 3-point shots and added a dunk during Xavier's 17-7 run over the first six minutes of the second half. Paulius Joneliunas led American (3-2) with 15 points, and Arvydas Eitutavicius had 11. The Musketeers held the Eagles' leading scorer, Andre Ingram, to just five points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
